fields.value: Immigration Politics and Partisan Realignment: California, Texas, and the 1994 Election

dsDescriptionValue.value: Public opinion data on United States and California macropartisanship, or mass party identification, from 1969-2010. Based on Gallup and Field Poll results, respectively. Also includes US-level measures of consumer sentiment, presidential approval, presidential party, and indicator for presidential administration. Additional data are from the Texas Poll from 1990-1998 to capture macropartisanship in Texas.

publicationCitation.value: Monogan, III, James E. and Austin C. Doctor. "Immigration Politics and Partisan Realignment: California, Texas, and the 1994 Election." State Politics and Policy Quarterly.

files.description: R code to clean raw data and produce aggregated time series. The raw data files required are: consumerSentiment.csv, presApprovalGallup.csv, unembargo_cumulative.sav, fieldQuarters.csv, caPartyUpdates.csv, macropartisanship.csv, and a subfolder named "texasPoll" containing all 37 files within texasPoll.zip.
files.label: aggregator.R

dataFile.description: R code to clean raw data and produce aggregated time series. The raw data files required are: consumerSentiment.csv, presApprovalGallup.csv, unembargo_cumulative.sav, fieldQuarters.csv, caPartyUpdates.csv, macropartisanship.csv, and a subfolder named "texasPoll" containing all 37 files within texasPoll.zip.

files.description: Alternative version of R code to clean raw data and produce aggregated time series, now using weights from the Field Poll. The raw data files required are: consumerSentiment.csv, presApprovalGallup.csv, unembargo_cumulative.sav, fieldQuarters.csv, caPartyUpdates.csv, macropartisanship.csv, and a subfolder named "texasPoll" containing all 37 files within texasPoll.zip.
files.label: aggregatorWeighted.R

dataFile.description: Alternative version of R code to clean raw data and produce aggregated time series, now using weights from the Field Poll. The raw data files required are: consumerSentiment.csv, presApprovalGallup.csv, unembargo_cumulative.sav, fieldQuarters.csv, caPartyUpdates.csv, macropartisanship.csv, and a subfolder named "texasPoll" containing all 37 files within texasPoll.zip.

files.description: This file runs two alternate versions of the macropartisanship time series models using data that includes partisan leaners--one version that simply adds leaners to partisan tallies, and another that focuses strictly on GOP shares of public support. This file uses raw inputs of MacropartisanshipLeaners.csv, consumerSentiment.csv, presApprovalGallup.csv, controlVars.csv, umembargo_cumulative.sav, fieldQuarters.csv, and caPartyUpdatesLeaners.csv.
files.label: alternateMeasure.R

dataFile.description: This file runs two alternate versions of the macropartisanship time series models using data that includes partisan leaners--one version that simply adds leaners to partisan tallies, and another that focuses strictly on GOP shares of public support. This file uses raw inputs of MacropartisanshipLeaners.csv, consumerSentiment.csv, presApprovalGallup.csv, controlVars.csv, umembargo_cumulative.sav, fieldQuarters.csv, and caPartyUpdatesLeaners.csv.

files.description: Complete R code to estimate every model reported in the article. This code replicates the results of all tables and figures reported in the article. It requires the following seven input data files: tx9098.csv, usMacropartisanship.csv, caTotalMacropartisanship.csv, caHispMacropartisanship.csv, caWhiteMacropartisanship.csv, ca1994exit.dta, and texas1994exit.dta.
files.label: analysis.R

dataFile.description: Complete R code to estimate every model reported in the article. This code replicates the results of all tables and figures reported in the article. It requires the following seven input data files: tx9098.csv, usMacropartisanship.csv, caTotalMacropartisanship.csv, caHispMacropartisanship.csv, caWhiteMacropartisanship.csv, ca1994exit.dta, and texas1994exit.dta.

files.description: Alternate R code to estimate every model reported in the article, this time including Field Poll weights. This code replicates the results of all tables and figures reported in the article. It requires the following seven input data files: tx9098.csv, usMacropartisanship.csv, caTotalMacropartisanship.csv, caHispMacropartisanship.csv, caWhiteMacropartisanship.csv, ca1994exit.dta, and texas1994exit.dta.
files.label: analysisWeighted.R

dataFile.description: Alternate R code to estimate every model reported in the article, this time including Field Poll weights. This code replicates the results of all tables and figures reported in the article. It requires the following seven input data files: tx9098.csv, usMacropartisanship.csv, caTotalMacropartisanship.csv, caHispMacropartisanship.csv, caWhiteMacropartisanship.csv, ca1994exit.dta, and texas1994exit.dta.

files.description: Quarterly data for California macropartisanship among Hispanic Field Poll respondents, 1969-2010. Also records national-level values of presidential approval, the political element of approval, consumer sentiment, a presidential party indicator, and a factor for presidential term. Several lagged variables are also reported.

files.description: Quarterly data for Texas macropartisanship, 1990-1998. Reports Republican and Democratic percentages of all survey respondents, as well as macropartisanship (percent Democratic of those identifying with one major party). Data are tabulated for all respondents, Hispanic respondents, and white respondents.
files.label: tx9098.tab

dataFile.description: Quarterly data for Texas macropartisanship, 1990-1998. Reports Republican and Democratic percentages of all survey respondents, as well as macropartisanship (percent Democratic of those identifying with one major party). Data are tabulated for all respondents, Hispanic respondents, and white respondents.
